$$NOTE01.text:
Subject:  New z/OS 2.1 Generic Tracker Facility GTZPRINT Utility
          ISPF Dialog
From:     William Smith <sfowjs@sbcglobal.net>
Date:     7/25/2014 12:49 PM
To:       sbgolob@cbttape.org

Here is a simple new ISPF dialog that automates generation of the
JCL, JECL, and control card statements for the z/OS 2.1 Generic
Tracker Facility.   It will execute on any JES2 or JES3 on which
we have enabled the tracker for EAV exception reporting.

The dialog consists of the following:

    GTZ invoking REXX EXEC
    GTZPRINT panel
    GTZP00 message member
    Two skeletons:  JOBCARD and GTZPSKEL

To execute   e.g. from Dialog Test option 7.1 - simply type %GTZ
or from any command line   TSO %GTZ.  The JOBCARD fields may be
changed/modified at your discretion to add routing and print
post-execution processing.  These values are not saved in the
ISPF profile   they are stowed in the SHARED pool.  Once the PDF
editor window appears with the file tailored JCL, simply type
SUB, END or hit PF3 and the GTZPRINT job will be submitted.  To
terminate EDIT and return to the GTZPRINT home panel   seen below
  type CAN or CANCEL.  To terminate the entire dialog, simply hit
PF3.  The dialog uses a DO WHILE loop to redisplay the GTZPRINT
panel after each job is submitted.

Although over-ridden in the screen capture below, the defaults
from top-to-bottom are  Y Y N N".  The skeleton uses the
IBM-recommended BLKSIZE of 80.  I think it can be dropped once we
are RACF-authorized to GTZPRINT and can test it across our 18
subject LPARs.

My next objective is to create a series of SAS programs to digest
the GTZPRINT report into something meaningful and hopefully less
voluminous.

Bill Smith

William J. Smith, M.A. Ed
(415) 531-7667 (iPhone)
sfowjs@sbcglobal.net

$$NOTE03.text:
Subject:  GTZPRINT ISPF Dialog - Updated with Corrections/Enhancements
From:     William Smith <sfowjs@sbcglobal.net>
Date:     9/5/2014 7:24 PM
To:       Sam Golob <sbgolob@cbttape.org>

Sam,

Please replace the Generic Tracker Facility Dialog with the
following replacement parts:

Invoking REXX EXEC:  GTZ
ISPF panel:  GTZPRINT
ISPF skeleton:  GTZPSKEL, JOBCARD
ISPF message:  GTZP00

Note that the z/OS logical not is represented as a PC SHIFT 6
(caret) due to EBCDIC to ASCII translation, our old nemesis.
It's most noticeable in the panel.  I have two new SAS programs
to replace the one I sent you earlier.  It is significantly
enhanced and corrected; it runs with SAS 9.2-9.4 with either JES2
or JES3 in a parallel sysplex WLM-managed scheduling environment
(tested on 18 LPARs).  The new version builds CSV files on z/OS
for subsequent upload to the workstation.  IBM offers nothing to
do this!  Keep posted.

Bill Smith

William J. Smith, M.A. Ed
IBM GIS/CTG   Datamatics
Infrastructure Architect
(415) 531-7667 (iPhone)
sfowjs@sbcglobal.net

ISPF panel:  GTZPRINT
ISPF skeleton:  GTZPSKEL, JOBCARD
ISPF message:  GTZP00

Note that the z/OS logical not is represented as a PC SHIFT 6
(caret) due to EBCDIC to ASCII translation, our old nemesis.
It's most noticeable in the panel.  I have two new SAS programs
to replace the one I sent you earlier.  It is significantly
enhanced and corrected; it runs with SAS 9.2-9.4 with either JES2

Bill Smith

William J. Smith, M.A. Ed
sfowjs@sbcglobal.net

GTZPRINT.text:
)ATTR
% TYPE(TEXT)  INTENS(HIGH) COLOR(WHITE)
¼ TYPE(TEXT)  INTENS(HIGH) COLOR(RED)
+ TYPE(TEXT)  INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(TURQ) SKIP(ON)
_ TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(YELLOW)
~ TYPE(TEXT)  INTENS(LOW)  COLOR(BLUE)
@ TYPE(TEXT)  INTENS(HIGH) COLOR(YELLOW)
)BODY EXPAND(\\) ASIS
¼\-\@The z/OS Generic Tracker Facility GTZPRINT Utility¼\-\
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                            +
~
~
~Print tracking facility current status %===>_Z+                   (Y=Yes/N=No)
~
~Print tracking facility tracking data  %===>_Z+                   (Y=Yes/N=No)
~
~Print tracking facility exclude filters%===>_Z+                   (Y=Yes/N=No)
~
~Print tracking facility debug filters  %===>_Z+                   (Y=Yes/N=No)
~
~
~Jobcard submission JCL/JECL. . .
%  ===>_JOBCARD1                                                              +
%  ===>_JOBCARD2                                                              +
%  ===>_JOBCARD3                                                              +
%  ===>_JOBCARD4                                                              +
%  ===>_JOBCARD5                                                              +
~
~
+Publications: GA32-0905 -%"z/OS MVS Diagnosis: Tools and Service Aids"
+              SC23-6861 -%"z/OS V2R1.0 DFSMSdfp Advanced Services"
~
)INIT
  .ZVARS  = '(STATUS,TRAKDATA,EXCLUDE,DEBUG)'
  .CURSOR = STATUS

  VGET (STATUS,TRAKDATA,EXCLUDE,DEBUG) SHARED

  IF (&STATUS = &Z)
    &STATUS ='Y'
  IF (&TRAKDATA = &Z)
    &TRAKDATA ='Y'
  IF (&EXCLUDE = &Z)
    &EXCLUDE ='N'
  IF (&DEBUG = &Z)
    &DEBUG ='N'

)REINIT
  REFRESH (*)
  IF (.MSG ¼= ' ')
    .ATTR(.CURSOR) = 'COLOR(YELLOW) HILITE(BLINK)'

)PROC
  VER (&STATUS,NB,LIST,Y,N,MSG=GTZP000)
  VER (&TRAKDATA,NB,LIST,Y,N,MSG=GTZP000)
  VER (&EXCLUDE,NB,LIST,Y,N,MSG=GTZP000)
  VER (&DEBUG,NB,LIST,Y,N,MSG=GTZP000)

  VPUT (STATUS,TRAKDATA,EXCLUDE,DEBUG) SHARED
  VPUT (JOBCARD1,JOBCARD2,JOBCARD3,JOBCARD4,JOBCARD5) SHARED

)HELP
)END
/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */
/*                                                                   */
/* Change History.....                                               */
/*                                                                   */
/* Updated, 30Jul14, William J. Smith, IBM GTS/CTG/Datamatics        */
/* . Added support for a fifth JOB statement                         */
/*                                                                   */
/* Written, 23Jul14, William J. Smith, IBM GTS/CTG/Datamatics        */
/* . Ref:  z/OS MVS Diagnosis:  Tools and Service Aids, GA32-0905-00 */
/*         "The Generic Tracker Facility", GTZPRINT Utility          */
/*         SYS1.SAMPLIB(GTZPRNTJ)                                    */
/*                                                                   */
/* ----------------------------------------------------------------- */

GTZPRM00.text:
/* Start of Specifications ********************************************

*01* MEMBER-NAME: GTZPRM00

*02* DESCRIPTIVE-NAME: Generic Tracker Parmlib member sample

*01* FUNCTION:

     Statements in a GTZPRMxx parmlib member allow to control the
     Generic Tracker. An alternative to statements in a GTZPRMxx
     member are the corresponding SETGTZ operator commands.
     Typically GTZPRMxx is used for longer lists of control
     statements or when the command parameters would exceed
     command line length limits.

     Please refer to the following publications for a complete list
     of allowed statements and commands and their syntax:

     * MVS Initialization and Tuning Guide (SA23-1379)
     * MVS System Commands (SA38-0666)

     The conversion tool GTZCNIDT, with sample JCL in GTZCNIDJ,
     can be used to create a GTZPRMxx parmlib member
     from an existing CNIDTRxx parmlib member as
     used by the pre-V2R1 version of the tracking facility.

     A typical use of a GTZPRMxx parmlib member is to specify
     an "exclusion list": A list of EXCLUDE statements which
     describe "uninteresting", already known tracked events.
     Any tracked event which matches one of those EXCLUDE statements
     will not be recorded by the tracking facility and
     any previously recorded tracked instances which match
     a newly added EXCLUDE statement will be deleted.

     This sample GTZPRMxx here contains an exclusion list of
     known tracked events that are typically of no interest anymore.

     For (DF)SMS related tracked events and EXCLUDEs, see also the
     following publication for more details:
     * DFSMSdfp Advanced Services (SC23-6861)

     See the z/OS Downloads web site for a possibly more current
     copy of this GTZPRMxx member.

     The current version is dated:  <see CHANGE-ACTIVITY below>

     IBM may periodically provide updates to this member to exclude
     events that have been reported. Correction of these events
     may be provided in future releases of the IBM product, if
     appropriate.


*01* OPERATION:

     A GTZPRMxx parmlib member can be specified
     (1) on the SET operator command, which accepts one or more
         GTZPRMxx suffixes: SET GTZ=xx or SET GTZ=(xx,...,zz)
     (2) on the GTZ system parameter which can be specified for
         example in the IEASYSxx parmlib member or in reply to
         message IEA101A at IPL time: GTZ=xx or GTZ=(xx,...,zz).

     The value of system parameter GTZ, if any, is what
     Generic Tracker uses at startup.

     The SET GTZ operator command can be used to add statements
     at a later time.

     The SETGTZ CLEAR operator command can be used to remove previous
     configuration statements.

     The DISPLAY GTZ operator command allows to display the
     different sets of currently active configuration statements,
     for example the current exclusion list: D GTZ,EXCLUDE.


*01* DISTRIBUTION LIBRARY: APARMLIB


*01* DEPENDENCIES: Online copy of this member at the
                   z/OS Downloads web site.

*01* CHANGE-ACTIVITY:

  Flag LineItem   FMID     Date    Id   Comment
   $L0=GENTRKR,  HBB7790, 121105, RDUT: Primed with latest CNIDTRxx
   $L1=GENTRKR,  HBB7790, 130425, RDUT: LSPACE OMEGAMON
   $L2=GENTRKR,  HBB7790, 130712, RDUT: One DEVTYPE
   $L3=GENTRKR,  HBB7790, 131104, RDUT: Adds for zDMF, TDMF
                                        Removed INZUTILK, IKJ* OBTAIN
                                        Remove redundant HOMEJOB=*

**********************************************************************/

 /* TPNS */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='CONVCON'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=ITPENTER
  )

 /* BMC MainView */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='MCSOPER: *'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=AULOAD
  )

 /* ServerPac OK */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 CVAFDSM*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=CPP605M
  )

 /* VTFM */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DCB OPEN EAS*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=HVT*
  )

 /* EREP */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DCB OPEN EAS*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=IFCEREP1
  )

  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DCB OPEN EAS*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=IGC0013I
  )

  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DCB OPEN EAS*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=DFHLDSVC
  )

  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DCB OPEN EAS 113-44'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=IEAVESLL
  )

  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DCB OPEN EAS 113-44'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=IEAVSTA1
  )

  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DCB OPEN EAS 113-44'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=IEAVTSFR
  )

  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DCB OPEN EAS 113-44'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=IGVVSTOR
  )

 /* FTP calls OK */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DADSM OBTAIN*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=EZAFTP*
  )

 /* Fixed by UA42664 */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DADSM OBTAIN*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=IGG0CLX0
  )

 /* @L3D */

 /* NewEra, See IFO 7.0 */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DADSM OBTAIN*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=IPLNSIM
  )

 /* System REXX */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DADSM OBTAIN*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=AXRINPVT
  )

 /* @L3D */

 /* ALL DEVTYPE CALLS */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-I:3 DEVTYPE*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH
  )

 /* @L2D */

 /* DSS DATA= */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-I:3 LSPACE DATA=*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=ADRDSSU
  )

 /* FTP */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-I:3 LSPACE DATA=*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=EZAFTPLS
  )

 /* ISPF EXPMSG= */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-I:3 LSPACE EXPMSG=*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=ISRUDA
  )

 /* Switch SMF */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-I:3 LSPACE*'
   HOMEJOB=*MASTER*
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=IEE70110
  )

 /* VARY DEVICE OFFLINE */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-I:3 LSPACE*'
   HOMEJOB=ALLOCAS
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=IEFW21SD
  )

 /* DFHSM */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-I:3 LSPACE DATA=*'
   HOMEJOB=DFHSM
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH
  )

 /* Omegamon @L1A */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-I:3 LSPACE DATA=*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=KDFSPDEV
  )

 /* Softek TDMF @L3A */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DCB OPEN EAS 113-44'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=GTD*
  )

 /* Softek zDMF @L3A */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DCB OPEN EAS 113-44'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=GZD*
  )

 /* Softek TDMF @L3A */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 CVAFDIR STAT082'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=GTD*
  )

 /* Softek zDMF @L3A */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 CVAFVSM STAT082'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=GZD*
  )

 /* Softek TDMF @L3A */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DADSM OBTAIN*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=GTD*
  )

 /* Softek zDMF @L3A */
  EXCLUDE(
   EVENTDESC='SMS-E:1 DADSM OBTAIN*'
   PROGRAMTYPE=NOPATH PROGRAM=GZD*
  )

GTZP00.text:
GTZP000  'Enter Y or N for report'     .TYPE=WARNING  .WINDOW=RESP
'Enter a value of Y for Yes or N for No to select a processing ' +
'option when creating JCL for a GTZPRINT batch report.'

GTZP001  'GTZPRINT ended RC=&RC'       .TYPE=NOTIFY   .WINDOW=RESP
'The GTZPRINT dialog has ended with a return code of &RC. due to ' +
'user requested termination using the END or RETURN command.  The ' +
'ISPF DISPLAY service was in control when the application ' +
'terminated.'

GTZP002  'File tailoring RC=&FTRC'     .TYPE=CRITICAL .WINDOW=RESP
'The ISPF FTINCL service has ended with a return code of &FTRC for ' +
'skeleton &skelname.. If the return code is 8, the specified ' +
'skeleton does not exist.  If the return code is 12, the skeleton ' +
'or table is in use; ENQ failed.  If the return code is 16, data ' +
'truncation occurred.  If the return code is 20, a severe error ' +
'occurred.'

GTZP003  'TSO SUBMIT ended RC=&SUBRC'  .TYPE=CRITICAL .WINDOW=RESP
'The TSO SUBMIT command has ended with a return code of &SUBRC.. ' +
'If the return code is 12, processing was unsuccessful and an error ' +
'message has been issued.  Possible error cause: submission of an ' +
'empty data set.'

GTZP004  'Edit session cancelled'      .TYPE=WARNING  .WINDOW=NORESP
'The GTZPRINT report generation dialog edit session was cancelled ' +
'by explicit use of the CANCEL PDF EDIT primary line command.'

GTZP005  'Batch report submitted'      .TYPE=NOTIFY   .WINDOW=NORESP
'A GTZPRINT batch report job has been submitted for background ' +
'(batch) execution.  A TSO notification will be sent to you upon ' +
'completion of the batch job.  Inspect the JCL, job log, and ' +
'utility messages for correct processing and any error messages ' +
'that may be present.'

GTZP000Z '&GTZSM'     .ALARM=&GTZALARM .TYPE=&GTZTYP .WINDOW=&GTZWIN
'&GTZLM'
